Sprite by dii_fbi
#277 0' 3.1"
26.56 lbs. 		Iguana Pokémon This iguana has scales made of hardened minerals that give superb defense against non-physical attacks. It is said that these colorful minerals are harder than diamonds.

Ability Learnset

By leveling up

Level Ability Score Description
1 Hydration 5 Heals status conditions if it's raining.
1 Mirror Armor 9 Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.
18 Color Change 2 The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.
36 Mimicry 3 Changes the Pokémon's type depending on the terrain.
54 Protean 8 Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.
72 Lightning Rod 7 The Pokémon draws in and neutralises Electric-type moves, boosting its Sp. Atk.
90 Beast Boost 7 The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
100 Multiscale 8 Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By Disc

Disc Ability Score Description
Disc 03 Own Tempo 4 This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.
Disc 05 Immunity 4 The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.
Disc 08 Trace 6 When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.
Disc 10 Water Veil 4 The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Disc 11 Ball Fetch 1 If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the first failed thrown Poké Ball.
Disc 13 Cloud Nine 6 Eliminates the effects of weather.
Disc 18 Mimicry 3 Changes the Pokémon's type depending on the terrain.
Disc 19 Liquid Voice 5 All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.
Disc 56 Rough Skin 6 This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By tutoring

Ability Score Description
Beast Boost 7 The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
Cold-Blooded 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.
Color Change 2 The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.
High Entropy 5 Boosts the Pokémon's Evasiveness under Gravity.
Hydration 5 Heals status conditions if it's raining.
Lightning Rod 7 The Pokémon draws in and neutralises Electric-type moves, boosting its Sp. Atk.
Marvel Scale 5 The Pokémon's marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.
Mirror Armor 9 Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.
Multiscale 8 Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.
Poison Heal 8 Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned instead of losing HP.
Protean 8 Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.
Rattled 4 Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.
Sand Force 7 Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
Scrappy 6 The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.
Shed Skin 8 The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.
Sprinkle Spit 5 The Pokémon makes it rain when it's hit by an attack.
Thermal Exchange 6 Boosts the Attack stat when hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.
Unaware 7 When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon's stat changes.
Weak Bones -4 Halves the Pokémon's Defense stat.
Wonder Guard 18 Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.
Wonder Skin 5 Makes status moves more likely to miss.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled
